word:
Seeking Heavenly Treasures

  (Sermon Sunday afternoon, October 28, 1894, Campground, Ashfield, N.S.W.) 


     [My text is] Matthew, sixth chapter, commencing at the nineteenth verse: "Lay not up for yourselves treasures upon earth, where moth and rust doth corrupt, and where thieves break through and steal: but lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust doth corrupt, and where thieves do not break through nor steal: for where your treasure is, there will your heart be also."
